description.narrative: Subnational institutions and systems in 14 targeted high-burden districts have strengthened capacities to deliver evidence-based MNCH, HIV/AIDS and nutrition care and services for children in a coordinated manner., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, including the most deprived, receive an integrated package of quality and equitable maternal, neonatal and child health (MNCH), HIV/AIDS and nutrition care and services.

participating-org.narrative: CENTRE FOR RURAL HEALTH UNIVERSITY OF KWAZULU NATAL
